intro: Phlox kelseyi, commonly known as the Kelseyi phlox, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the western regions. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant floral display. The plant typically produces showy clusters of pink to purple flowers in early to mid-summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
